examples: … scandals don't make very savory reading.

definition: pleasing to the sense of taste or smell especially by reason of effective seasoning
examples: the savory smells wafting from the kitchen

definition: having a spicy or salty quality without sweetness
examples: an assortment of both sweet and savory appetizers

definition: being, inducing, or marked by the rich or meaty taste sensation of umami
a small serving of food that is spicy or salty but not sweet
examples: Those tempted toward savories can nibble on smoked-salmon or lobster-rémoulade tea sandwiches.

definition: the taste sensation that is produced by several amino acids and nucleotides (such as glutamate and aspartate) and has a rich or meaty flavor characteristic of cheese, cooked meat, mushrooms, soy, and ripe tomatoes : umami
